metadata.title: CVE-2023-28862 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in LemonLDAP::NG before 2.16.1. Weak session IDgeneration in the AuthBasic handler and incorrect failure handling during apassword check allow attackers to bypass 2FA verification. Any plugin thattries to deny session creation after the store step does not deny anAuthBasic session.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-28862` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemonldap-ng - 2.18.2+ds-1
lemonldap-ng-fastcgi-server - 2.18.2+ds-1
lemonldap-ng-handler - 2.18.2+ds-1
lemonldap-ng-uwsgi-app - 2.18.2+ds-1
liblemonldap-ng-common-perl - 2.18.2+ds-1
liblemonldap-ng-handler-perl - 2.18.2+ds-1
liblemonldap-ng-manager-perl - 2.18.2+ds-1
liblemonldap-ng-portal-perl - 2.18.2+ds-1
liblemonldap-ng-ssoaas-apache-client-perl - 2.18.2+ds-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lemonldap-ng package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.18.2+ds-1').
